docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 27. -- The Uruguayan Government severed diplomatic relations with Soviet Russia this morning, sending their passports to Alexander Minkin, the Soviet Minister, and other members of the Legation in Montevideo.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 27. -- The Uruguayan Government severed diplomatic relations with Soviet Russia this morning, sending their passports to Alexander Minkin, the Soviet Minister, and other members of the Legation in Montevideo.

headline.main: URUGUAY EXPELS SOVIET MINISTER TO STOP REVOLTS; Relations Severed on Charge Moscow Agitates Latin American Outbreaks.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 28 (AP).--The Soviet Minister, Alexander Minkin, who already has been handed his passport by the Uruguayan Government, in a note tonight categorically denied all charges made against his government as reasons for severing relations...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 28 (AP).--The Soviet Minister, Alexander Minkin, who already has been handed his passport by the Uruguayan Government, in a note tonight categorically denied all charges made against his government as reasons for severing relations with Russia.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Dec. 28. -- A "cheesy story" is the Soviet answer to Uruguay's rupture of relations.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Dec. 28. -- A "cheesy story" is the Soviet answer to Uruguay's rupture of relations.

headline.main: URUGUAY'S ACTION BLAMED ON CHEESE; Izvestia Says South American Nation Threatened Break if Purchases Were Not Made.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: RUSSIAN NOTE RETURNED.; Uruguayan Foreign 'Minister Gives Denial Message to Envoy.

docs.snippet: Sen gets bill creating special univ studies to train teachers to combat communism
docs.abstract: Sen gets bill creating special univ studies to train teachers to combat communism

headline.main: BRAZILIAN BILL SETS CURB ON AGITATORS; Deportation of Alien Foes of the Regime Provided -- Teachers to Receive Anti-Red Training.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 30. -- The growing tension between Germany and Lithuania has caused so much anxiety in London that today the British Government felt it necessary to intervene in Berlin.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 30. -- The growing tension between Germany and Lithuania has caused so much anxiety in London that today the British Government felt it necessary to intervene in Berlin.
docs.abstract: Advisability of joining USSR as insurance against German attack openly discussed

headline.main: BRITISH INTERVENE IN MEMEL DISPUTE; They Question Germany on an Exchange With Lithuania of Political Prisoners.
